full_summary:
**Tender Announcement: TBIPS A.6 Programmer/Software Developers, Level 2 Specializing in MS Power BI**

**Reference Number:** cb-7192-47079937

**Solicitation Number:** 30003394

**Amendment Number:** 2

**Publication Date:** 2023-07-12

**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-08-10T14:00:00

**Contract Duration:** Five (5) years from the date of contract award

**Tender Notice:**
Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders with a Tier 2 classification to submit proposals for a requirement of up to 12 A.6 Programmer/Software Developers, Level 2 specializing in MS Power BI.

**Scope of Work:**
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) requires the services of A.6 Programmer/Software Developers Level 2 with expertise in MS Power BI design/development. The resources will develop MS Power BI reporting features, on an as-and-when-required basis, through the issuance of task authorizations (TA), for various Information Technology (IT) projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, test, and deploy Microsoft Power BI reports, dashboards, and Applications
* Report curation, data visualizations, and insights
* Deploy required tools to facilitate analytics and business intelligence
* Knowledge transfer of material to DFO staff to facilitate management and future developments of the tool

**Security Requirements:**
This requirement adheres to the Common PS SRCL #06 security requirement, with a minimum corporate security requirement of Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and a minimum resource security requirement of Reliability Status.

**Inquiries and Required Documents:**
Inquiries regarding this request for proposal (RFP) requirement must be submitted to Meenu Bhatia, Contracting Authority, at [meenu.bhatia@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:meenu.bhatia@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) and [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca). RFP documents will be e-mailed directly to qualified supply arrangement holders.

**Important Notes:**

* The TBIPS method of supply is refreshed three (3) times per year.
* Interested parties seeking to become Qualified TBIPS Holders should contact [RCNMDAI-NCRIMOS@
